thread.title: Holiday Baking Championship Season 10 Episode 1 Release Date, Preview & Streaming Guide
thread.title_full: Holiday Baking Championship Season 10 Episode 1 Release Date, Preview & Streaming Guide

author: Alberto Zambrano
title: Holiday Baking Championship Season 10 Episode 1 Release Date, Preview & Streaming Guide
text:
The year is almost over, and Food Network and its competitors are banking on reality unscripted competition cooking shows with seasonal touches. Case in point: Holiday Baking Championship Season 10. It’s time to see which of these teams of bakers can craft the most exciting, tasty, and impressive holiday-themed dessert of it all in hopes of winning a big cash prize.
Ahead of its premiere, we prepared for you all the details you should know concerning the show, along with its format, and many other things that are worth knowing. Just one word of advice, if you have a sweet tooth, make sure you watch this on a full stomach because these bakers make the best cakes with the best ingredients and that will make you hungry! Without any further ado, let’s check out what’s ahead for us in season 10 of this cooking show.
Preview
Hosted by renowned chef and Food Network staple chef Bobby Deen, the show has a panel of judges made up of Nancy Fuller, Lorraine Pascale, and Duff Goldman who will put to the test a team of eight bakers to see if they can make bake the most impressive, delicious and challenging cookies, desserts and holiday-themed treats out there in hopes of winning a grand cash prize of $50,000.
Each episode consists of a round in which they must bake a themed cookie, the winner gets an advantage for the next round in which they must make some other dessert like a cake, souffle, or whatever other surprise. The winner of the previous round not only gets extra time to complete their task, but they also get to restrict or take away certain ingredients from the competition.
The desserts are judged by the panel based on execution, presentation, taste, and other aspects that make the show a very competitive one. One that as stated earlier, shouldn’t be watched on an empty stomach because you will get hungry.
Release Date & Where to Watch
Holiday Baking Championship Season 10 Episode 1 will be broadcast by Food Network on Monday 6 November 2023 at 20:00 hrs Eastern Time, United States. The season’s debut episode is titled “Season’s Best”. Each episode lasts around 45 minutes. In the following list, you’ll find the regional time release schedules for this program.
- Pacific Time (PT): Monday, 6 November 2023, at 17:00 hrs (5:00 PM PT)
- Mountain Time (MT): Monday, 6 November 2023, at 18:00 hrs (6:00 PM MT)
- Central Time (CT): Monday, 6 November 2023, at 19:00 hrs (7:00 PM CT)
- British Summer Time (BST): Tuesday, 7 November 2023, at 01:00 hrs (1:00 AM BST, the next day)
- Central European Summer Time (CEST): Tuesday, 7 November 2023, at 02:00 hrs (2:00 AM CEST, the next day)
- Australian Eastern Standard Time (AEST): Tuesday, 7 November 2023, at 11:00 hrs (11:00 AM AEST, the next day)
- India Standard Time (IST): Tuesday, 7 November 2023, at 05:30 hrs (5:30 AM IST, the next day)
- Singapore Time (SGT): Tuesday, 7 November 2023, at 08:00 hrs (8:00 AM SGT, the next day)
- New Zealand Standard Time (NZST): Tuesday, 7 November 2023, at 14:00 hrs (2:00 PM NZST, the next day)
Watch the latest episodes of Holiday Baking Championship Season 10 via Food Network at the times and dates described above. If you have cable, you can use your cable credentials to log in to Food Network’s website or its app to stream the show online.
If you’re part of the cable-cutting crowd, there are many ways to enjoy this holiday cooking show, as live television streaming subscription providers like
Hulu + Live TV, YouTube TV, Directv Streaming, Philo, Spectrum on Demand and Fubo TV will stream the show during its broadcast times.
Consider Getting A Discovery Plus Subscription To Watch Holiday Baking Championship Episodes
If you like cooking shows like these and enjoy all the programming offered by Food Network, you can consider getting a
Discovery Plus subscription for as low as $5 a month. Discovery Plus is a WarnerMedia-owned platform that distributes the entirety of all of Food Network as well as all the Discovery Network’s content.
You’ll have ad-free unlimited access to all the shows on such channels as TLC, Discovery Channel, Animal Planet,
History Channel, A&E, and many more.
Furthermore, Discovery Plus comes either as a standalone platform or bundled on top of your Amazon
Prime Video subscription. If you really like shows like this one, and are looking for an alternative to educational and documentary streaming platforms, Discovery Plus is your place to go.
Episode Guide
- Episode 1: “Season’s Best” – Monday, 6 November 2023
- Episode 2: “Can’t Wait For Turkey Day” – Monday, 13 November 2023
- Episode 3: “Hallmarks of Thanksgiving” – Monday, 20 November 2023
- Episode 4: “TBA” – Monday, 27 November 2023
- Episode 5: “TBA” – Monday, 4 December 2023
- Episode 6: “TBA” – Monday, 11 December 2023
- Episode 7: “TBA” – Monday, 18 December 2023
